ARABIC: مُتَّكِـِٔينَ عَلَىٰ رَفْرَفٍ خُضْرٍ وَعَبْقَرِىٍّ حِسَانٍ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Reclining on green quilts and exquisite rugs.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Reclining on green cushions and rich carpets excellent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: They shall be reclining on green cushions and splendid carpets.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: They will be reclining on plain green and beautifully printed cushions
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Reclining on green cushions and beautiful decorated carpets.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Reclining on green Rafraf and rich beautiful `Abqariy.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Reclining on green cushions and beautiful carpets.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: reclining upon green cushions and lovely druggets --
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Reclining on green cushions and fair carpets.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: [They will live in such a paradise] reclining upon green cushions and the finest carpets.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Reclining upon cushions green and carpets beauteous.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Reclining on green cushions and lovely carpets.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Reclining on green Cushions and rich Carpets of beauty.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Reclining on green cushions and rich beautiful mattresses.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Reclining on green cushions and fine carpets.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Reclining on green cushions, and exquisite carpets.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Reclining on green cushions and beautiful fine carpets.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [55:76] Reclining, namely, their spouses (muttaki’īna, syntactically, it is as [described] above) upon green cushions (rafraf is the plural of rafrafa, which can mean [either] ‘carpets’ or ‘cushions’) and lovely druggets (‘abqariyyin, the plural of ‘abqariyya, which are velvet carpets).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: Reclining on green cushions) and it is also said: in meadows (and fair carpets) beautifully coloured carpets.
